etymology.description: 日(日) (rì, "sun") on top + 日(日) (rì, "sun") below = brightness from two suns -> prosperous
etymology.interpretation: 昌(昌) (chāng, "prosperous") combines two 日(日) (rì, "sun") characters to symbolize great brightness and vitality, indicating prosperity and flourishing.

examples.chinese: 改革开放(改革開放)，使经济昌盛(使經濟昌盛)。
examples.english: Reform and opening up have led to a thriving economy.
